verses.verse: After these things, Jesus went off to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (of Tiberias).
And a big crowd was following Him because they were watching His indicators that He was doing on the people who were weak.
Jesus went up into the mountain and was sitting there with His students.
The Passover, the festival of the Jewish people, was near.
So when Jesus raises His eyes and sees that a big crowd is coming to Him, He says to Philip, "Where will we buy loaves of bread from so that these people might eat?"
But He was saying this, trying to trouble him. You see, He realized what He was going to be doing.
Philip answered Him, "Two hundred denarii ($10000) worth of loaves of bread is not enough for them that each of them might take some bit."
One from among His students, Andrew (the brother of Simon Peter), says to Him,
"There is one little boy here who has five loaves of barley bread and two tilapia, but what are these for so many people?"
Jesus said, "Make the people settle down on the ground." There was a lot of grass in the place. So the men (the number as if it were five thousand) settled down on the ground.
Jesus took the loaves of bread, and after being thankful, He passed them out to the students, but the students to the reclining people (likewise also from the tilapia), as much as they were wanting.
As they were filled up, He says to His students, "Gather up the leftover pieces so that nothing will be ruined."
So they gathered and filled twelve baskets full of pieces from the five loaves of bread, the barley bread, that were left over with the people who had dined.
So when the people saw that He did an indicator, they were saying, "This truly is the Preacher, the one that is coming into the world."
So when Jesus knows that they are going to be coming and to be snatching Him so that they might make Him king, He took a back way again into the mountain Himself alone.
As it became evening, His students walked down on the sea,
and after they climbed on board into the boat, they were going to the other side of the sea to Capernaum. And it had already become dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
And the sea was wide awake, a huge wind blowing.
So having driven the boat forward as if it were twenty-five or thirty track laps (3 or 4 miles), they see Jesus traipsing around on the sea and becoming near the boat. And they were afraid.
But Jesus says to them, "It is Me. Don't be afraid."
So they were wanting to take Him into the boat. And right away the boat became up to the land to which they were going back.

The next day the crowd, the one that had stood on the other side of the sea, saw that no other small boat was there except that one into which His students climbed on board, and that Jesus did not go into the small boat together with His students, but only His students went away.
(But other small boats came from Tiberias near the place where they ate the bread after the Master was thankful.)
So when the crowd saw that Jesus isn't there, nor His students, they also climbed on board into the boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, "Rabbi, when have You become here?"
Jesus answered them and said, "Amen, amen, I tell you, you are looking for Me, not because you saw indicators, but because you ate from the loaves of bread and were full.

Work, not for the dining, the dining that gets ruined, but for the dining, the dining that stays for life that spans all time, that the Son of the Person will give to you. You see, God, the Father, put a seal on this One."
So they said to Him, "What should we do so that we may work God's actions of work?"
Jesus answered and said to them, "This is the work of God, that you should trust in whom that One sent out."
So they said to Him, "So what indicator are you doing so that we might see it and trust You? What are You working?
Our fathers ate the manna in the backcountry, just as it has been written, (in Psalm 78:24) 'He gave them bread from the heaven to eat.'"
So Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I tell you, Moses has not given you the bread from the heaven, but My Father gives you the bread from the heaven, the true bread.
You see, the bread of God is the One stepping down from the heaven and giving life to the world."
So they said to Him, "Master, always give us this bread."
Jesus said to them, "I am the Bread of the life. The one coming to Me will not in any way be hungry, and the one trusting in Me will not in any way be thirsty at any time.
But I said to you, 'You have even seen Me, and you do not trust.'
Everything that the Father gives Me will arrive to Me. And the person coming to Me, I will not in any way throw outside
because I have stepped down from the heaven, not so that I may do what is wanted, what I want, but what the One who sent Me wants.
This is what the Father who sent Me wants, that everything that He has given to Me, I would not lose anything from it, but I will get it up during the last day.
This is what the One who sent Me wants, that everyone watching the Son and trusting in Him may have life that spans all time, and I will get him up at the last day."
So the Jewish people were grumbling about Him because He said, "I am the Bread, the Bread that stepped down from the heaven."
And they were saying, "Isn't this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does He now say, 'I have stepped down from the heaven?'"
So Jesus answered and said to them, "Don't grumble with each other.
No one is able to come to Me unless the Father, the One who sent Me, tugs on him. And I will get him up at the last day.
It has been written in the Preachers, (in Isaiah 54:13) 'And all will be people taught of God.' So everyone who heard from the side of the Father and who learned comes to Me
because no one has seen the Father except the One who is from the side of God. This One has seen the Father.
Amen, amen, I tell you, the person trusting in Me has life that spans all time.
I am the Bread of the life.
Your fathers ate the manna in the backcountry and died.
This is the Bread, the One stepping down from the heaven so that anyone might eat from Him and not die.

I am the Bread, the Living Bread, that stepped down from the heaven. If anyone eats from this Bread, he will live for the span of time. Also the bread that I will give is My physical body that I will give on behalf of the life of the world."
So the Jewish people were arguing to each other, saying, "How is this Person able to give us His physical body to eat?"
So Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I tell you, if you do not eat the physical body of the Son of the Person and drink His blood, you do not have life in yourselves.
The person chewing My physical body and drinking My blood has life that spans all time, and I will get him up at the last day.
You see, My physical body truly is a dining, and My blood truly is a drinking.
The person chewing My physical body and drinking My blood stays in Me and I in him.
Just as the living Father sent Me out on a mission and I live because of the Father, also the person chewing Me, that person will also live because of Me.
This is the Bread, the One that stepped down from heaven. Unlike how your fathers ate the manna and died, the person chewing this Bread will live for the span of time."
These things He said in a synagogue teaching in Capernaum.
So when many from among His students heard it, they said, "This message is harsh. Who is able to be listening to it?"
But Jesus, who realized in Himself that His students are grumbling about this, said to them, "Does this trip you up?
So what if you watch the Son of the Person stepping up to where He was the prior time?
The spirit is what gives life. The physical body is not a benefit in any way. The statements that I speak to you; it is spirit and it is life.
But there are some from among you who do not trust." You see, Jesus realized from the beginning which people are the ones not trusting and which person is the one who will turn Him in.
And He was saying, "Because of this I have stated to you, 'No one is able to come to Me unless it is a thing that has been given to him from My Father.'"
From this, many of His students went off to the things left behind and no longer traipsed around with Him.
So Jesus said to the Twelve, "You don't also want to be going back, do you?"
So Simon Peter answered Him, "Master, who will we go off to? You have statements of life that spans all time.
And we have trusted and have known that You are the Anointed King, the Son of God, the living God."
Jesus responded to them, "Didn't I select you, the Twelve, and one from among you is an accuser?"
He was talking about Judas (a son of Simon), an Iscariot. You see, this man was going to be turning Him in, one who was from among the Twelve.
